artefact.overview: If you're approaching State Pension age you can get a forecast of how much you'll receive
artefact.body:
You can get a forecast of how much State Pension you may get - you might want to do this when you’re close to State Pension age.

How you get your forecast depends on when you reach State Pension age.

Use the calculator to find out when you’ll reach State Pension age.

You reach State Pension age before 6 April 2016

You can get a State Pension forecast online, by phone or in the post. You’ll usually get your forecast within 10 working days.

Online

You can only get a forecast online if:

  • you live in the UK
  • you’re more than 4 months away from State Pension age
  • you’re not a woman over 60

By phone or by post

You can get a forecast up to 30 days before you reach State Pension age.

Call the Future Pension Centre or complete the application form and post it to the address on the form.

Download ‘State Pension forecast application’ (PDF, 317KB)

Changes to the State Pension from October 2012 mean that the amounts shown in your forecast may change.

If you just want a quick estimate use the State Pension calculator.

You reach State Pension age on or after 6 April 2016

Your can get a forecast, known as a ‘statement’, by phone or by post. You can’t get a statement online. You’ll usually get your forecast within 10 working days.

You’re over State Pension age or less than 30 days away from it

You can still get an estimate of your State Pension by calling the Pension Service.

The Pension Service
Telephone: 08456 060 265
Textphone: 0800 731 7339
Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm

Call the International Pension Centre if you live outside the UK.

International Pension Centre
Telephone: +44 191 218 7777
Textphone: +44 191 218 7280
Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm

There are leaflets to help you understand your pension forecast
